args: I did a quick pass through the inside of the\nruins, but I didn't see anything that looked\neven remotely like treasure.
Still, I'd wager there's a hidden chamber\nsomewhere, and your lineage's key is the\nonly way in.
I wonder what the key even IS? I never got\nanything like that from my fathâ€”EEEEEK!
Never fear, just a rat. It ran off into that\ncrack in the wall.
There's a space on the other side of that\nwallâ€”and on THIS side, there is a single\nhand-shaped indentation.
Aisha, would you mind terribly\nlaying your palm upon it?
ANALYZING BIOMETRIC INFORMATION.\nAUTHORITY FACTOR DETECTED.\nRELEASING LOCK.
It appears your bloodline itself is the key.
Well then, let's head in. I can't wait to see\nwhat treasures lie in wait for us!
I've seen these used by the imperials.\nI believe it to be some kind of\nancient magical weapon.
Look thereâ€”a stone slate with ancient\nwriting chiseled upon it.
Interesting. It seems these ruins were a\nlaboratory some one thousand years ago.
They were expanding the functionality \nof existing armaments here, and the\nweapon you see there is the result.

B-B-B-BIOMETRIC PRINT IDENTIFIED.
AUTOMATIC STARTUP INITIATED...
RESUMING EXPERIMENT.
WHAT ARE YOUR ORDERS, CHIEF?
Oh my gosh, that thing is TALKING!\n...And wait, did it just call me ï¼‚Chiefï¼‚?
One of your paternal ancestors must have\nbeen responsible for this lab.

COMBAT ORDERS REQUIRED.
COMBAT ORDERS REQUIRED.
COMBAT ORDERS COMBAT ORDER
ORDER ORDER ORRRRRRR...
Ah ha! THERE ya are, Lapis!\n...Wait, what the hell is that?
Oh, my dear sweet prince. You really\nfollowed us all the way out here?

ORDERS NOT CONFIRMED.
ENTERING AUTO-COMBAT MODE.
LIFE FORMS DETECTED. EXTERMINATING!
EXTERMINATING! EXTERMINAâ€”
The hey? It up and disappeared!
Gya! Where did that attack come from?!
Hold on while I deploy a smokescreen!
Well, I'll be a smokin' hot pretzel...\nThere's a silhouette in the smoke!
Come! We must hide ourselves away\nwhile the thing has lost our scent!
What's happening, Lapis? I thought the\nenemy vanished, but it was actually right\nthere the whole time?
It has been modified with a camouflage\nmode that allows it to bend light around\nitself, effectively rendering it invisible.
How in blazes do ya know all this?
From this stone slate. But it's clearly been\nsitting here for so long it's malfunctioning.\nIt's attacking whatever it sees.
If it leaves the ruins, chaos will ensue.\nWe must stop it.
But how do ya fight somethin'\nwhat ya can't even see?
Couldn't we just use smoke like before\nto at least see its outline?
I'm afraid that was my last smokescreen.\nBut I have another idea...
Prince, you and Ranzal do what you can\ndo draw its attention. This will give me\nan idea of where it is located.
Once I've confirmed the enemy position,\nI'll blow it away with my manacaster.

I really hate the first part'a this plan.
How the hell do we know ya won't just
head for the hills the moment we step
out and start distractin' it?!
You think Lapis would abandon you?
Crossed my mind, yeah. She's a THIEF,\nkid! She ain't got no moral code!
You're not wrong to be suspicious.\nThere's no way I could ask you to trust me.
But if you think about it...what other choice\ndo you really have?
She's right, Ranzal. If we don't trust her,\nthis thing is going to break out of here\nand ravage the surrounding area.
Besides, if Lapis DOES run away, it just\nmeans we're in the same situation we\nwould have been in anyway.

Wow, that's bleak. But yeah, I getcha.
Oh, and Lapis? I ain't the kinda man what
forgets a double-crossâ€”or forgives it.
Ya hear what I'm sayin'?
Merci to you both. Let us commence!
Okay, we got its attentionâ€”now we just\nneed to keep avoiding its attacks!
The enemy is attacking while moving,\nmaking it hard for it to aim.
Oh no! One of its shots hit that wall\nand it's coming down!
Damn, I can't see Lapis anywhere!\nThere's too much dust!
Dust... That's it! Attack the walls\nto kick up more dust!
I see it! It's right there!
Gah! I barely made a dent...
Crap, the dust is clearin'!\nWe're gonna lose it again!
Oh, I never let my prey get away.\nAu revoir, mon rocky ami.
It's down! The guardian sentinel is down!\nBut where did that attack COME from?
I'm rather good with a caster,\nwouldn't you say?
Side-stepping a collapsing wall is a\nsimple matter for one such as I.
But I must say, well done, my prince.\nUsing the dust to suss out the enemy\nwas quite clever indeed.
I guess it just sort of came to me.
Quick on your feet, a good judge of \ncharacter, and as righteous as ever.\nOh, what a fine prince you are!
Why, I've half a mind to let you \ncapture me...
